result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek W Langan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.  Maintain/Obtain full time employment and/or schooling.  Follow though with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
To be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek W Langan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

6 months Straight Time (Credit - 0 days)

Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
- Perform  50 hours of community service;
- Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment and or schooling;

Restitution: $4700.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Costs: $253.00 
DNA Surcharge:  WAIVED
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Court schedules a sentencing date in approximately 3 weeks to allow for victim notification.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Sonderhouse advises the Court working on a resolution with involves up front payment of restitution.  Attorney Sonderhouse to advise how case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Sonderhouse is provided a restitution request in Court by the State.  Attorney Sonderhouse requests the Court set the matter out in two weeks to review status of case.  Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court, in custody, with attorney Zachary Hoff for Ronald James Sonderhouse.    Attorney David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No discovery yet. Parties to let know how case will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
